dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4633 IH: Credentialing, Educating, and Relevant Training Initiative For Your Heroes Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Womack (for himself, Mrs. McMorris Rodgers, Mr. Bishop of Georgia, Mr. Russell, and Mr. Carter of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to permit individuals who are eligible for assistance under a Department of Defense educational assistance program or authority to use such tuition assistance for licensing and certification programs offered by entities other than an institution of higher education.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Credentialing, Educating, and Relevant Training Initiative For Your Heroes Act or the CERTIFY Heroes Act.

section.header: Clarification regarding use of Department of Defense tuition assistance for licensing and certification programs
section.text: Section 2006a(a) of title 10, United States Code, is amended in the matter preceding paragraph (1)â€”

paragraph.text: by striking Effective as of August 1, 2014, an and inserting An; and
by striking as follows and inserting that satisfies one or more of the following requirements.
